topic.title: DataDirect ODBC Drivers for Greenplum Database

body.p: ODBC drivers let user with third party applications connect via a common interface to their Greenplum Database system. This document guides you through installing DataDirect Connect XE for ODBC 7.1 drivers for Greenplum on either a Linux or Windows system. Unless specified otherwise, references to DataDirect Connect XE for ODBC refer to DataDirect Connect XE for ODBC and DataDirect Connect64 XE for ODBC.
Access the ODBC drivers from EMC Subscribenet (login required) here:

topic.title: Before you begin - serial numbers/license keys

body.p: Note your appropriate serial number/license key (use the same number for both when installing the drivers):

li.p: DataDirect Connect XE for ODBC 7.1 drivers (32-bit drivers): 1076681728
DataDirect Connect64 XE for ODBC 7.1 drivers (64-bit drivers): 1076681984

body.p: DataDirect Connect XE for ODBC drivers for Greenplum are tested against Greenplum Database Versions 3.3, 4.0, 4.1, and 4.2.
DataDirect Connect64 XE for ODBC drivers for Greenplum support the following 64-bit client platforms:

li.p: AIX 64: 7.1, 7.0, 6.1, 5.3 Fixpack 5 or higher
Linux Itanium: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 6.x, RHEL 5.x, RHEL 4.x
Linux x64: RHEL 6.x, RHEL 5.x, RHEL 4.x, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES) 11, SLES 10
Solaris on SPARC: 11 and 11 Express (Solaris 5.11), 10 (Solaris 5.10), 9 (Solaris 5.9), 8 (Solaris 5.8)
Solaris x64: 11 (Solaris 5.11), 10 (Solaris 5.10)

p.ph: Windows x64: Windows 7, Vista, Server 2008, Server 2003, XP Professional SP 2

body.p: DataDirect Connect XE for ODBC drivers for Greenplum support the following 32-bit client platforms:

li.p: AIX 32: 7.1, 7.0, 6.1, 5.3 Fixpack 5 or higher
Linux x86: Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 6.x, RHEL 5.x, RHEL 4.x, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server (SLES) 11, SLES 10
Solaris on SPARC: 11 and 11 Express (Solaris 5.11), 10 (Solaris 5.10), 9 (Solaris 5.9), 8 (Solaris 5.8)
Windows: Windows 7, Vista, Server 2008, Server 2003, XP SP2

body.p: Download the DataDirect ODBC for Greenplum installer on Subscribenet, then follow this procedure.

li.p: Uncompress the installer:
Double-click setup.exe. This launches the install wizard.
Select Run to start installation.
Accept the End User License Agreement and select Next.
Select OEM or Licensed Installation as the installation type.
Enter your licensing information: Division name, Company Name, and serial number/license key found in .
Select Add. You should see this driver in the License dialog box:
ODBC Greenplum Wire Protocol Third Party All Platform Server Unlimited Cores
Select Next.
Confirm the driver you want to install. You should see this driver:
ODBC Greenplum Wire Protocol Third Party All Platforms Server Unlimited Cores.
Choose options appropriate for your installation. For example, If asked, replace the existing drivers or create the default data servers.
Select Next.
Select an installation directory.
Select Next.
Select Install to begin installation.Installation may take several minutes
Select Done to complete installing the driver package.
Open the Windows ODBC Administrator. (Start > All Programs > DataDirect > ODBC Administrator.
Click the Drivers tab, and scroll down to DataDirect <version> Greenplum Wire Protocol. Ensure you see the expected version number.

topic.title: Configuring and testing a DSN connection to a Greenplum Database

body.p: To configure and test a DSN connection to a Greenplum Database:

li.p: Open the ODBC Administrator.
Select the System DSN tab.
Select Add.
Select DataDirect Greenplum Wire Protocol Driver.
Enter the details for your chosen Greenplum instance. Example:
Recommended: Set the Max Long Varchar size.
Select the Advanced tab.
In Max Long Varchar Size, enter 8192 then select Apply.
Select Test Connect.
Enter your user name and password, then select OK.
You should see the confirmation message Connection Established!

body.p: If your connection fails, check the following for accuracy:

li.p: Host Name
Port Number
Database Name
User Name
Password
Greenplum instance is active
